response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, and ½ tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, beat 1 cup sugar and ½ cup butter until light and fluffy. Add 2 eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 1 tsp vanilla extract and ½ cup milk, blending until smooth.",
  "step3": "Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture, alternating with ½ cup boiling water. Mix until just combined; the batter will be thin. Pour evenly into the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula.",
  "step4": "Bake 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.",
  "step5": "For frosting, beat ½ cup butter until creamy. Add 2 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy, adding more milk if needed for spreadable consistency.",
  "step6": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate, spread frosting over the top. Add the second layer, then cover the entire cake with a thin crumb coat. Chill 15 minutes, then finish with a final thick layer of frosting, smoothing edges and adding decorative chocolate shavings."
}
